etymology.description: 豆(豆) (dòu, "bean") + phonetic 枀->士(士) (shì, "scholar") = sound component -> fermented soybeans
etymology.interpretation: The character 豉(chǐ, "fermented soybeans") combines 豆(豆) (dòu, "bean") as the semantic indicator emphasizing the ingredient, with the phonetic 士(士) (shì, "scholar") suggesting its pronunciation.

examples.chinese: 传统食品中加入豉(傳統食品中加入豉)，能使菜肴增香(能使菜肴增香)。
examples.pinyin: Chuántǒng shípǐn zhōng jiārù chǐ, néng shǐ càiyáo zēng xiāng.
examples.english: Adding fermented soybeans in traditional foods can enhance the aroma of dishes.

examples.chinese: 他精心研磨豉(他精心研磨豉)，制成美味调料(製成美味調料)。
examples.pinyin: Tā jīngxīn yánmó chǐ, zhìchéng měiwèi tiáoliào.
examples.english: He carefully grinds the fermented soybeans to make delicious seasonings.
